title: Projects & Case Studies

title: Projects & Case Studies

Each case study highlights the context, my role, the tools and frameworks used, and the key learnings.

title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
Professional Projects



Concrete Pipes Market Expansion ‚Äì Truck-Mounted & Stationary Pumps (China‚ÄìMexico, 2019)


Context:
After massive steel imports from China and a booming market driven by competitors, Mexican concrete pumping customers needed more competitive prices on pipe systems for both truck-mounted and stationary pumps (lay-down and high-rise applications), creating an opportunity to find new partners to maintain market share.
My Role:
Commercial lead and project manager for identifying, analazing and developing a new international supplier.
What I did:

Research, identified and evaluated Chinese steel pipes manufacturers for concrete pumps.

Coordinated technical validation with service teams and key customers.

Structured pricing, margin, and inventory proposals for the Mexican market.

Prepared commercial materials, technical training and supported sales teams during launch.

Results / Impact:

Increase the company‚Äôs market share by approximately 25% in the concrete pipe segment.

Contributed to an estimated 15% increase in sales for this product line.

Strengthened the company‚Äôs position in both truck-mounted and stationary pump projects.






Lubricants Distributor Financial Analysis ‚Äì Mobil Exxon vs Shell (Mexico, 2017)


Context:
Aftermarket management needed to choose the best long-term partner between two lubricant distributors (Mobil Exxon vs Shell) for parts and service in construction and mining equipment customers.
My Role:
Consultant analyst commercial and financial evaluation.
What I did:

Performed ratio and trend analysis (profitability, liquidity, leverage, efficiency).

Reviewed historical sales volumes, margins, and payment behaviour.

Presented an executive summary with risks, opportunities, and recommendations.

Results / Impact:

Provided a structured, data-driven resport comparison that clarified the financial and operational differences between the two alternatives.

Decision-making support by selecting the distributor with better credit behaviour, stronger growth potential, and profitability.






National Retrofit Campaign ‚Äì Truck-Mounted Concrete Pumps (Mexico, 2016)


Context:
Putzmeister brand in its main product the truck-mounted concrete pumps (sold in 2014‚Äì2015) required a turret retrofit to prevent failures and ensure long-term reliability.
My Role:
Supervisor for the national retrofit campaign.
What I did:

Worked with the PM factory to define technical scope, and procedures.

Built a national schedule and risk plan for all affected units and clients.

Negotiated downtime windows with customers to minimize disruption.

Coordinated service teams, spare parts, and documentation.

Results / Impact:

Completed the campaign across the national fleet using project crashing techniques, resulting in a reduction of the overall timeline by about 10 days

Improved customer trust and confidence

Strengthened collaboration between service, parts, and sales teams.

title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
MBA Academic Projects



Digital Transformation Strategy ‚Äì Lumen5 (CMPT 641)

Focus:
Analysis and evaluation on how Lumen5 can move from a creator-oriented freemium tool to an enterprise-grade video platform.
My Role:
Co-author of recommendations and roadmap, lead for Ecosystem Growth recommendation.
Key Points:

Used Sociotechnical Systems (STS) and TOE frameworks to analyze misalignments between the product, organization, and market.

The recomendation of a re-positioning strategy which focuses on governance, ROI, security, and scalability for marketing teams (enterprise).

Designed a 24-month roadmap including partnerships, integrations, and data-driven value.

Impact / Learning:

Developed a stronger understanding of how to connect technical capabilities, business model, and organizational change.






400 kW Rooftop Solar Power Plant ‚Äì Project Management Plan

Focus:
Created a full project management plan for a 400 kW rooftop solar power plant.
My Role:
Project planning and scheduling.
Key Elements:

Built a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and Risk Breakdown Structure (RBS).

Developed a detailed schedule in ProjectLibre with task dependencies, critical path, ES/EF/LS/LF, and slack.

Assigned resources (labor, equipment, materials) and estimated total duration and budget.

Performed basic project crashing analysis to reduce the duration by 5 business days.

Impact / Learning:

Practiced applying project management tools to a real-world renewable energy context.

Strengthened skills in risk management, scheduling, and cost/time trade-offs.

title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
How These Projects Connect

Across both professional and academic projects, my work follows the same pathway:

Integration of technical and business thinking

Data-driven decision-making (KPIs, experiments)

Project and risk management in complex operations

These experiences reflect my MBA approach: applying
AI, analytics, and structured project management to create practical, measurable results in real organizations.

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Use & Reflection
text:
This appendix provides full transparency on how Large Language Model (LLM) tools were used to support the creation of my MBA Portfolio Multi Webpage
It explains:

Which prompts I used and for what purpose.

Examples of the unedited draft text generated by the model.

How I verified, edited, and personalized the content.

Which sections are entirely my own work.

The goal is to demonstrate ethical and responsible AI use that aligns with University Canada West‚Äôs academic-integrity expectations.

title: Reflection
text:
The project of my electronic portfolio is basically a compilation of professional and personal evidence that demonstrates and enhances intellectual and professional development within the competency-based MBA program. Moreover, the multimedia format allows for the representation of progress and learning achievements, with particular weight in the relevant sections (Thomas et al., 2025). Nevertheless, my expectations for LLMs‚Äô performance and reliability are too high, given the presence of bias during the process, which impacts the output, and the weaker areas where the models struggle, such as ethics or health themes. Now, my perspective is different and serves to return to human thinking and to use the models as tools, not as a principal source that replaces humans. Additionally, the transition from a single-page to a multipage project poses the challenge of integrating various files, connecting them, and providing a design to improve visualization.
Understanding how to give instructions or feed the model with the most accurate inputs to obtain the best outputs, while avoiding bias during the process, is crucial. However, the brainstorming and suggestions provided by the models help refine ideas, clarify concepts, and create better, more structured sections, while optimizing time and speed. Furthermore, maintaining my own voice gives each section of the project an original, self tone. It reflects my personality in each rewrite draft, where the essential facts are decided by me and not for the model, giving a special personalization to my experiences, such as work roles, project achievements, skills, and certifications.
Using multiple models allows me to test which is more concise, structured, and accurate in its responses, and which has the best AI behavior, tone, and level of expertise for my project development. Moreover, understanding the importance of the prompt message, the user message, and their relationship helps me know how modern AI in LLMs works.
Throughout all phases of the project (single- and multipage portfolio), the main reflection is on not relying on or delegating everything to the LLMs without a sense of responsibility, critical thinking, and human judgment. Likewise, the necessity of balancing and achieving joint optimization in which the system performance requires both people and technology, allows social and technical systems optimization. Additionally, it will enable me to present my professional identity through a web portfolio.





‚Üë Top
